thread.title: Liverpool team to face Leicester revealed - Daniel Sturridge and Dejan Lovren miss out on King Power clash
thread.title_full: Liverpool team to face Leicester revealed - Daniel Sturridge and Dejan Lovren miss out on King Power clash

author: Liam Prenderville
title: Liverpool team to face Leicester revealed - Daniel Sturridge and Dejan Lovren miss out on King Power clash
text:
Sturridge in action during training (Photo: John Powell) Share     
Daniel Sturridge is out of Liverpool's clash with Leicester. 
The England striker flew back from his side's warm-weather training camp in La Manga due to a virus. 
That was over a week ago but Sturridge has not recovered in time to play. 
Dejan Lovren also misses out for the Reds despite returning to training following a knee problem. 
Skipper Jordan Henderson also plays no part at the King Power. Leicester fans show their support to Ranieri (Photo: Getty Images Europe) Scarves for sale before the match (Photo: PA) 
Leicester caretaker boss Craig Shakespeare has made one change from the side beaten by Sevilla in Claudio Ranieri's last match. 
Sjinji Okazaki returns to the starting line-up, as Ahmed Musa misses out. 
Leonardo Ulloa, who said he would never play for the club again after missing out on a January move is back on the bench. Ulloa is back on the bench (Photo: Getty) Teams 
Leicester: Schmeichel, Simpson, Morgan, Huth, Fuchs, Drinkwater, Ndidi, Mahrez, Albrighton, Okazaki, Vardy. 
Subs: Zieler, Chilwell, Gray, King, Amartey, Ulloa, Slimani 
Liverpool: Mignolet, Clyne, Matip, Lucas, Milner, Can, Wijnaldum, Lallana, Mane, Coutinho, Firmino. 
Subs: Karius, Moreno, Klavan, Stewart, Alexander-Arnold, Origi, Woodburn poll loading Will champions Leicester get RELEGATED this season? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
